H0.text: Removed is what happens to energy when work is done by a system.

H1.text: Stored energy is what happens to energy when work is done by a system.

H2.text: Added energy occurs when a system does work.

H3.text: Multiplied is what happens to energy when work is done by a system.

A4.text: In a cyclic process in which the system does net work on its surroundings, it is observed to be physically necessary not only that heat be taken into the system, but also, importantly, that some heat leave the system.

A5.text: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, but it can be transformed from one form to another.
